bib_record.title: -GAMMA-RAY SPECTROMETRIC MEASUREMENTS OF THE CAPTURE CROSS SECTION OF GOLD-198 FOR REACTOR NEUTRONS.-

free_txt: COMPUTER ANALYSIS OF GAMMA SPECTRA.
.THE AMOUNT OF AU198 PRODUCED DURING THE IRRADIATIONS
DID NOT EXCEED ABOUT 0.5 PER CENT OF THE AU197 CONTENT
OF THE TARGET AT ANY TIME.  UNDER THESE CONDITIONS
AU198 MAKES A VARYING, BUT ALWAYS NEGLIGIBLE,
CONTRIBUTION TO THE THERMAL NEUTRON SELF-SHIELDING
FACTOR (REDUCING IT BY 0.0002 AT MOST).
.SMALL CORRECTION (LESS THAN 0.25 PER CENT) FOR NA24
(PRODUCED BY THE REACTION AL27(N,A)NA24) CONTRIBUTION
TO GAMMA-SPECTRUM MADE.
.IN THE PRESENT EXPERIMENTS THE NEUTRON TEMPERATURE
WAS KNOWN TO VARY OVER THE RANGE OF SPECTRUM EMPLOYED
BY, AT MOST, 44 DEG C, BUT MORE PROBABLY BY 30 DEG C,
THUS THE NEUTRON TEMPERATURE AT THE CORE OF PLUTO IS
.ASSUMING THE 2200 M/SEC CAPTURE CROSS SECTION OF CO59
TO BE 37.4 BARN IT WAS FOUND THAT,
THE CAPTURE CROSS SECTION OF AU198
WHERE R * ROOT(T/T(0)) IS WESTCOTT S EPITHERMAL INDEX
PARAMETER.  THE CROSS SECTION FOR MAXWELLIAN NEUTRONS
(T = 70 DEG C) WAS GIVEN.
3 IN. * 3 IN. NAI(TL) CRYSTAL COUPLED TO AN
EMI TYPE 9531 B PHOTOMULTIPLIER FEEDING A LABEN 100-
CHANNEL SPECTRASCOPE.
.1 CM LENGTHS OF 0.005 IN. DIAMETER COBALT WIRE, 2 CM
LENGTHS OF A 0.025 IN. DIAMETER 1 PC SILVER IN AL-
ALLOY WIRE AND 2.5 MM LENGTHS OF A 0.050 IN. DIAMETER
0.976 PC COBALT IN AL-ALLOY WIRE WERE USED AS NEUTRON
FLUX AND EPITHERMAL INDEX MONITORS.
SYSTEMATIC ERRORS PLUS 1 SIGMA.
THE PLUTO REACTOR.
REACTOR NEUTRONS WITH VARYING EPITHERMAL CONTENT.
ACTIVATION, DEDUCTION OF CROSS SECTION FOR
MAXWELLIAN NEUTRONS FROM VARIATION OF EFFECTIVE CROSS
SECTION FOR REACTOR NEUTRONS WITH EPITHERMAL CONSTANT
OF SPECTRUM.
.APPROX. 0.25 CM LENGTHS OF A 0.018 IN. DIA-
METER GOLD-ALUMINIUM ALLOY.
.THE GOLD CONTENT WAS DETERMINED BY X-RAY FLUORESCENCE
SPECTROGRAPHY, COLORIMETRY AND NEUTRON ACTIVATION
ANALYSIS TO GET THE WEIGHTED MEAN 0.698 +- 0.011 PER
CENT.
= 37.4 +- 0.3 B FOR THERMAL NEUTRONS.
GAMMAS.
APPROVED BY CABELL.
